page.title: 03Gradient Test
page.content: All vehicles at the Ministry of Defence are tested on gradients to see if they are able to stop and restart on them. 4 slopes are used in this test:1:2;1:2.5;1:4 and 1:5.All the slopes are tarmaced with the exception of the 1 in 2 slope which is grassed and only used for tracked vehicles. On our visit Ministry of Defence we watched a fork lift JCB drive up a 1:4 slope.It successfully went up on the first test but on the second test,which involved stopping and restarting on the slope,there was much wheel spinning and we smelt burning rubber.However after about 20 seconds it managed to go up the hill.The reason that it first had difficulty was because there was no weight on the front of the vehicle.
